intro: Psychotria randiana, commonly known as the "blue hibiscus" or "blue hibiscus tree," is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking blue flowers, which are actually modified leaves known as hypanthium. Psychotria randiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique and colorful blooms. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and partial shade for optimal growth.
